Award.AwardTitle: Student Travel Support for the Symposium on Stabilization, Safety and Security (SSS 2012)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
This project supports participation for 20 US-based students to the 14th International Symposium on Stabilization, Safety, and Security
(SSS 2012) to be held in Toronto, Canada during October 1?4, 2012. The purpose of the participation is to expose students to the theoretical modeling of important properties such as safety, robustness, stability, etc. in large systems.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The 14th International Symposium on Stabilization, Safety, and Security of
Distributed Systems (SSS 2012) was held in Toronto, Canada, during
October 1-4, 2012. This project provided travel support for US-based students to attend SSS'12 and hence to gain first hand knowledge in the key areas of stabilization, safety and security in networks and distributed systems, and to bring back the knowledge to their home institutions for the enrichment of their research. It also enabled them to identify critical problems of current and future importance in these areas. The travel support was used to specifically encourage the participation of women and minority students, in order to better motivate these underrepresented communities towards advanced computer science education and research in these areas.

 While stabilization helps distributed systems spontaneously recover from the effects of failures and environmental perturbation like user demands and node mobility, safety and security are of critical significance in a world where physical and cyber security are under constant threat. The ability to gain knowledge in these areas is crucial for the US to maintain global leadership in a competitive world. The US-based students in Computer Science benefit from the exposure to newer areas of research. A fraction ofthe research results will eventually enrich the Computer Science curricula in US universities.
